definition: to express goodwill/to be friendly
to show/to reveal
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to

sentences.english: But buttering up China appears to be a new priority.
sentences.chinese: 但顯然向中國示好成爲其當務之急。

sentences.english: It's the latest move by a Western luxury brand to endear itself to the Chinese consumer.
sentences.chinese: 這是西方奢侈品牌向中國消費者示好的一個最新舉措。

sentences.english: When the tender wife seeks her husband's society, he comes to her on wings of love.
sentences.chinese: 溫柔的妻子向丈夫親暱示好，丈夫就投入她的懷抱。

sentences.english: Certainly, the wealthy brocade once deliberated for well to a little bit send goodwill gestures what in the applicable opportune moment.
sentences.chinese: 當然，錦繡也思量過在適當的時機稍微的示好什麼的。

sentences.english: He means well, but I am getting sick of his attitude.
sentences.chinese: 他雖対我示好，可我卻討厭他這副態度。

definition: to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
to be particularly attentive to (an attractive young lady or man etc)/to fawn upon (an influential politician etc)/to court sb's favor/to ingratiate oneself
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to cast flirtatious glances at sb (idiom)
to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
to pressure
to illuminate/to open up (a topic)
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
to provoke/provocation
to tactfully decline/to turn down gracefully
to defect/to surrender/to capitulate
toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
to concede/to give in/to yield/a concession/(linguistics) concessive
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
olive branch/symbol of peace
